decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is utilizing the "Combo - Reanimator" archetype in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier through cards such as Faithless Looting, Unmask, and Entomb. It then uses spells like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Exhume to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield, bypassing their high mana costs. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Grief to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively swarm the board with goblin creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Aether Vial to cheat out goblins onto the battlefield quickly and efficiently. It also includes various goblin lords and synergistic creatures to boost the power and resilience of the goblin tribe. The deck aims to generate significant damage through attacking multiple times per turn and leveraging the abilities of goblin creatures, such as Muxus, Goblin Grandee, to generate card advantage and additional creatures. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Stingscourger and Goblin Cratermaker to hinder the opponent's strategy. The deck's land base provides a mix of mana acceleration and removal options to support the aggressive goblin strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw. It utilizes cards like Prismatic Ending, Swords to Plowshares, and Leyline Binding to remove threats from the opponent's side of the board. Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect your own game plan. LÃ³rien Revealed, Ponder, Brainstorm, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide card advantage and selection. The deck also includes Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters as win conditions. The mana base is built to support multiple colors, allowing access to a wide range of spells.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Control deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through card advantage and disruption. The deck features a variety of powerful spells such as Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to control the opponent's board and hand. It also includes powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck utilizes lands like Wasteland and Mystic Sanctuary to further disrupt the opponent's mana base and recur important spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and out-value the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Seasoned Dungeoneer to apply pressure while also playing disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Touch the Spirit Realm to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck aims to generate mana advantage through cards like Chrome Mox, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide, allowing for explosive plays and maintaining board control. The mana base consists of various land types and powerful mana sources like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to ensure smooth mana production.

This deck is an aggressive artifact-based blue deck that focuses on using artifacts to gain advantage and control the game. It utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble, Urza's Bauble, and Thoughtcast to draw additional cards and keep the hand full. It also includes cards like Chalice of the Void and Metallic Rebuke to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck also has powerful creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Hullbreacher to apply pressure on the opponent. Lastly, it utilizes Urza's Saga to search for specific artifacts and gain additional advantage.

This deck is a Legacy 1 vs 1 control deck known as Stiflenought. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining board control. The key strategy revolves around using cards like Wasteland, Daze, and Stifle to keep the opponent off balance and hinder their plays. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dress Down to deal with threats. The deck's win condition is Phyrexian Dreadnought, which can be cheated into play and combined with Dress Down to become a formidable threat. It also incorporates card draw and selection through Ponder and Brainstorm to maintain consistency and find the necessary pieces. Supporting creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Brazen Borrower, and Murktide Regent provide additional board presence and value.

This deck focuses on using artifacts, specifically blue ones, to apply pressure and maintain card advantage. It utilizes cards like Lotus Petal, Ancient Tomb, and Grim Monolith to generate mana quickly, while cards like Urza's Bauble and Mishra's Bauble provide card draw and filtering. Paradoxical Outcome and Emry, Lurker of the Loch synergize with the artifact-heavy strategy, allowing for explosive turns and additional card advantage. The deck aims to win through either overwhelming the opponent with its artifact army or by using Aetherflux Reservoir to deal a massive amount of damage in one turn.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells and removal spells such as Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Prismatic Ending. The deck also features card advantage and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Leyline Binding. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The manabase is designed to support the deck's color requirements with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while gradually establishing a winning position.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle. It focuses on applying early pressure and tempo advantage through efficient cheap spells like Lightning Bolt, Ponder, and Brainstorm. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to quickly close out games while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Wasteland and Mishra's Bauble to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck is an aggressive Canadian Threshold archetype in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format. The key focus of the deck is to utilize efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by disruptive spells such as Daze, Force of Will, and Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes tools for card selection and manipulation like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm. The inclusion of Murktide Regent and Unholy Heat adds additional threats and removal options. The mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to consistently cast spells and activate abilities.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a combo using a combination of fast mana (Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, Chrome Mox, Simian Spirit Guide), tutors (Summoner's Pact), and protection (Pact of Negation, Chancellor of the Annex). The goal is to use Undercity Informer, Balustrade Spy, and Elvish Spirit Guide to mill the entire deck, triggering Narcomoeba to create a board presence. Dread Return can then be cast to bring back a powerful creature like Thassa's Oracle, and if necessary, Cabal Therapy can be used for disruption. The deck also includes backup win conditions like Bridge from Below and Agadeem's Awakening.
